image.altText: External images of Reiby Youth Detention Centre.

props.synopsis: For three years a NSW government department fought to stop the release of footage of an alleged assault on a teenager at a youth detention centre.

title.children: Court orders release of 'vicious' CCTV footage after three-year legal battle

image.altText: Clive Palmer NPC

props.synopsis: Reactionary newspapers and the outdoor advertising sector might have immediately profited from the last few weeks of the election campaign but it didn't seem to help politicians at the polls.

title.children: Who won the election culture wars? Not Dutton or Palmer

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in front of a crowd after the 2025 federal election

props.synopsis: The election may be over, but cost of living is still front of mind for Australians. These graphs show how we got here and what the new government has to do to rein in rising prices.

title.children: How did the cost of living get so bad? These graphs show how prices skyrocketed

image.altText: Tim Wilson smiles as he stands in front of supporters, in a blue shirt and black jacket.

props.synopsis: The state of play in two highly contested Victorian seats has become clearer overnight, with Tim Wilson set to reclaim Goldstein for the Liberal Party and Labor's Peter Khalil to retain Wills.

title.children: Liberal Party reclaims Goldstein, while Labor MPs retain Franklin and Wills

image.altText: Mark Carney and Donald Trump speak in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The cordial tone of the leaders' meeting mostly belied the bitter trade war being fought by their countries.

title.children: 'Takes two to tango': Takeaways from the Trump-Carney White House chat

props.synopsis: What data about voters' age, income level and home ownership status can tell us about the election result.

title.children: What we know about how the young and the rich are voting

image.altText: Exterior of the building, which is surrounded by skyscrapers

props.synopsis: In the middle of a housing crisis, when a sizeable amount of commercial real estate is sitting vacant, the Make Room project is billed as a blueprint for giving under-utilised buildings new life as residential spaces - and lowering carbon emissions in the process.

title.children: How an empty building in Melbourne's CBD has been transformed into home

image.altText: close up of friedrich merz wearing glasses and he has a shocked look on his face

props.synopsis: Mr Merz received 325 votes in the second ballot which was 15 more votes than he received in the first vote.

title.children: Friedrich Merz confirmed German chancellor after initial shock defeat

image.altText: two men who were prisoners of war exchange a hug after being released

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenskyy confirmed the news on social media, sharing images of the freed soldiers hugging loved ones and holding aloft Ukraine flags.

title.children: More than 200 Ukrainian soldiers freed in prisoner of war swap with Russia

image.altText: a group of cardinals and bishops

props.synopsis: An ancient ritual, steeped in tradition and shrouded in secrecy, begins in the Sistine Chapel today. So what can we expect?

title.children: The conclave to elect a new pope starts today — here's what we can expect

image.altText: A white cloak embellished with gold design hangs vertically near mitres inside a glass cabinet.

props.synopsis: In a corner of central Rome, a family tailor shop has been hand-stitching the robes worn by the last eight popes over the past 200 years, and they're ready for the busy task of preparing outfits for Pope Francis's successor.

title.children: Some popes keep their robes simple, others are 'more saucy'

image.altText: A composit image of a charging battery symbol and a man installing rooftop solar.

props.synopsis: Slashing the price of home batteries was one of Labor's flagship policies during the election campaign. With the election now in the review mirror, it's now time to look at what's exactly on offer in its Cheaper Home Batteries Program.

title.children: Labor's home battery subsidy kicks off 'strong demand'

image.altText: A woman stands looking at small jewels which are encased in a square wooden frame inside a glass case

props.synopsis: Jewels linked to the physical remains of the Buddha are set to be sold at auction, sparking a threat of legal action from India and moral questions about the sale of religious antiquities.

title.children: India threatens legal action over sale of ancient jewels

image.altText: An aerial shot of someone swimming in a river, with ice banks on either side of them.

props.synopsis: Weekend warriors to elite athletes hail the benefits of cold water immersion, but the research is yet to support its claimed benefits.

title.children: Evidence yet to back up claimed benefits of cold water therapy

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Two boys, aged six and seven, were due to receive their yellow belts in karate on the day their bodies were found in a home in NSW Central West.

title.children: Dead Coonabarabran brothers were set to receive yellow karate belts tonight

image.altText: Ian Wilkinson walks through a court precinct, dressed in a polar fleece-style jacket.

props.synopsis: Pastor Ian Wilkinson, the sole surviving guest of a lunch containing death cap mushrooms, has given evidence in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial.

title.children: Surviving lunch guest describes how sickness set in after deadly mushroom meal

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a grey singlet and beige cap sits in his backyard.

props.synopsis: Luke Bantoft has survived melioidosis but the experience has left him "petrified" of returning to his home where he believes he caught it. Experts say the source of the outbreak could be the Bruce Highway upgrade.

title.children: A rare disease is killing Queenslanders. A highway upgrade could be to blame

image.altText: Melissa Jansen

props.synopsis: Labor gained seven seats in Queensland, snatching five from the LNP including suburban seats once considered a sure thing for the Coalition.

title.children: 'Dutton, absolutely not': Howard's battlers turn away from the LNP

image.altText: Australian musician James Baker in 2024 lounging at home

props.synopsis: Australian punk rock pioneer James Baker, founding member of The Scientists, Hoodoo Gurus and The Beasts of Bourbon, has died from cancer at age 71.

title.children: James Baker, trailblazing Australian punk drummer, dies

image.altText: Harristown house fire

props.synopsis: Several people are injured and a child remains unaccounted-for after a house fire on Queensland's Darling Downs.

title.children: Child unaccounted-for after Toowoomba house fire

image.altText: A sign reading Port Augusta Prison Smoke Free Environmen outside a car park and brown building

props.synopsis: A new section of Port Augusta Prison had barriers that were constructed wide enough that a prisoner could slip through. The design flaw was fixed before the unit opened.

title.children: New SA prison unit had gaps 'large enough for a prisoner to squeeze through'

image.altText: Jacinta stands in front of Peter Dutton. They are standing in front of Australian flag, Australia's emblem also seen.

props.synopsis: "Doubling down on cultural wars" and a misreading of the Voice referendum result contributed to the Coalition's election loss, says a former Liberal minister.

title.children: 'Wouldn't handle it that way': Former Liberal minister on 'culture war' campaign

image.altText: Max Chandler-Mather speaks while standing in front of the budget tree at parliament house

props.synopsis: Greens MP Max Chandler-Mather says he has no regrets after losing his seat in the election on Saturday

title.children: 'It's bloody awful': High-profile Greens MP on time in parliament

image.altText: Doechii smizes while wearing a cream/yellow LV-embossed suit and holding a cigar, with a glorious afro.

props.synopsis: The 2025 Met Gala was all about self-expression and the contributions Black people have made to high fashion. Which celebrities nailed the theme?

title.children: The celebrities who nailed the 2025 Met Gala theme, according to experts

image.altText: An aerial shot of a film studio complex featuring many large warehouse-like buildings.

props.synopsis: Shock waves have been sent through the domestic film industry after US President Donald Trump announced his intention to slap a 100 per cent tariff on films "produced in foreign lands".

title.children: Trump's film tariffs throws Gold Coast vision into doubt, industry says

image.altText: A man sitting on a stage wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Leading economist Professor Ross Garnaut says Labor could seize on its thumping election win to revisit significant reforms such as the carbon price and mining tax.

title.children: Could Labor's thumping election win put tax reform back on the agenda?

image.altText: A slightly smiling man leaning against a table with a microphone, hands under chin, caucasian, bald, wears shirt.

props.synopsis: Snowy Mountains councillor Andrew Thaler has been ordered to apologise for alleged misconduct. He says he has been denied the presumption of innocence.

title.children: Controversial NSW councillor suspended without pay

image.altText: Michael McCormack 3 (1)

props.synopsis: Riverina MP and former deputy PM Michael McCormack says anyone not willing to cast a legitimate vote has no right to complain about the outcome of the election.

title.children: MP berates informal voters after dud ballot spike in NSW seat

image.altText: Josh Giddey with Benny's Boys players after a social game in Franskton.

props.synopsis: A social basketball team in Frankston did a double take when they saw Chicago Bulls star Josh Giddey suiting up for the opposition on Monday night.

title.children: 'This game's not going to go our way': NBA star crashes social game in Melbourne

image.altText: Kate Hulett and her supporters at an election night function

props.synopsis: Kate Hulett, who has said she will be "raging" against a proposed Woodside gas extension if elected, may be delivered to parliament thanks to the Liberals preferencing her above Labor.

title.children: Liberal preferences may help elect Climate 200-backed independent who vows to end gas

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: A flat battery has led two alleged e-bike hoons into the long arm of the law after a helicopter was used to track them on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Teenagers clocked going 120kph on e-bike but no charges laid

image.altText: Plastic Garfield toy in packet

props.synopsis: The fast food chain has been fined more than $150,000 for breaching safety laws after putting 27,000 toys containing button batteries in children's meals with no warning.

title.children: Button batteries in fast food toys a 'loaded gun' as Hungry Jack's fined

image.altText: A group of men walking in black clothes, balaclavas and sunglasses to protect their identities.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne man's case will go to a contested hearing after he disputed the criminal nature of charges relating to his alleged role leading a white supremacist rally through Ballarat.

title.children: Thomas Sewell argues neo-Nazi rally was political but 'not offensive'

image.altText: Woman in green shirt smiles leaning on man in white shirt who also smiles. A piano is in the background.

props.synopsis: Richard Tognetti is exacting, virtuosic and at the helm of one of the world's best chamber orchestras. He sits down with Virginia Trioli to talk work ethic, what brings him joy and what irks him.

title.children: Why the head of one of the world's best orchestras still worries about scales
